conclusion: Analyze graphs to determine pressure-temperature relationship for ideal gas.
Two graphs: pressure vs. temperature and volume vs. temperature, showing changes from 200 K to 600 K.
Pressure increases linearly with temperature; volume remains constant.
Volume remains constant as temperature increases from 200 K to 600 K.
With constant volume, pressure must also be constant during temperature increase.
Pressure at 600 K is the same as at 200 K, which is 1.5 Ã— 10^5 Pa.
